meanings.definition: To cause pain or trouble to
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site can ail my headache.
meanings.sent2: The broken chair leg will ail anyone who sits on it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to ail the grumpy old cat for fun.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to ail the mood of the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The persistent itch on my arm continued to ail me throughout the day.

meanings.definition: To feel unwell or suffer from an illness
meanings.sent1: After eating the expired food, I started to ail and feel sick.
meanings.sent2: During flu season, many people may ail with a cold or fever.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character pretended to ail from a made-up illness for attention.
meanings.sent4: The neglected garden began to ail and wither without proper care.
meanings.sent5: The tired marathon runner could feel his legs starting to ail from exhaustion.
